page.content: The next few pages contain the{ {Thorncombe Woods and Black Heath {Trail,}this can be obtained there for a 10p donation. {1:}This SECTION of SWEET CHESTNUT trunk shows the annual growth rings in the timber and some of the events that occurred during its life are indicated. {2:}SWEET CHESTNUT can be seen growing near the track. Regrowth from this old stump has occurred since the tree was felled in 1968. It has very durable timber which is useful for fencing {3:}The ridge crossing the path is a ROMAN ROAD which connected{Durnovaria} (Dorchester) and{Londinium}(London) via Badbury Rings and Old Sarum. It is said that the ghost of a Roman Centurian has been seen in the wood after dark!
